DOC.brief_summary: This was a non-significant risk (NSR), prospective, multi-center, single arm clinical trial that aimed to evaluate safety and performance of the Acclarent Tympanostomy Tube Delivery System (TTDS).
DOC.brief_title: Acclarent Tympanostomy Tube Delivery System for the Treatment of Patients Requiring Tympanostomy Tube Insertion
DOC.criteria: Diagnosed with either chronic otitis media with effusion (OME) or recurrent acute otitis media (AOM) and scheduled to undergo tympanostomy tube insertion History of sensitivity or reaction to anesthesia chosen for the procedure Markedly atrophic, mono or bimeric, severely retracted, atelectatic or perforated tympanic membrane Otitis externa Active acute otitis media Otitis media pathology requiring Ttubes Stenosed ear canal Anatomy that precludes sufficient visualization of and access to the tympanic membrane Anatomy that necessitates tympanostomy tube placement in the posterior half of the tympanic membrane
